info.title: Meetup Venues API
info.description: The API for managing Meetup venues.

get.description: Searches for public venues within a given geo space. To search for specific venues that your group has used, use the [Venues](/meetup_api/docs/2/venues) method

parameters.name: *city
parameters.description: A valid city

parameters.name: *country
parameters.description: A valid country code.

parameters.name: *group_urlname
parameters.description: Returns venues with location relative to the group associated with this urlname

parameters.name: *lat
parameters.description: A valid latitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

parameters.name: *lon
parameters.description: A valid longitude, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

parameters.name: *state
parameters.description: For the US, a valid 2 character state code

parameters.name: *text
parameters.description: Venues that contain the given term or terms somewhere in their content. Separate terms with  AND  for venues that have combined terms. Append a trailing * to treat this as a prefix search

parameters.name: *zip
parameters.description: A valid US zip code, limits the returned venues to those within radius miles

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius, in miles for geographic requests, default 25.0 -- maximum 100.0

parameters.name: since_count
parameters.description: Request that some number of recent messages be sent immediately, if available. May not be specified in the same request as since_mtime.

parameters.name: since_mtime
parameters.description: Return recent open venues with an mtime greater then the supplied time, in milliseconds since the epoch

parameters.name: trickle
parameters.description: When supplied with a request, the Meetup API will push your client the entire Meetup database of public venues in batches of 512

get.description: Search for Meetup venues by one of your groups, events, or venue identifiers. For a full text search on public venues use [OpenVenues](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_venues).

parameters.name: *event_id
parameters.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

parameters.name: *group_id
parameters.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

parameters.name: *group_urlname
parameters.description: path to group from meetup.com, no slashes

parameters.name: *venue_id
parameters.description: multiple ids may be separated with commas

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output

get.description: Returns venues a group has previously hosted events at

post.description: Interface for creating new Meetup venues

parameters.name: *address_1
parameters.description: Primary address of the venue

parameters.name: *city
parameters.description: City name of the venue

parameters.name: *country
parameters.description: 2 character country code of the venue

parameters.name: *name
parameters.description: Unique name of the venue

parameters.name: *state
parameters.description: If in the US or CA, the state code for the venue

parameters.name: address_2
parameters.description: Secondary address info

parameters.name: hours
parameters.description: Open hours information about the venue

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Optional phone number for the venue

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Optional value indicating the venues visibility to others. May be one of private or public. Defaults to public

parameters.name: web_url
parameters.description: Optional web url for the venue

get.description: Returns venues Meetup finds relevant to you based on location and category. This method does not yet support sorting or pagination.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 category ids to help inform recommendations

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group ids to help inform recommendations

parameters.name: group_urlname
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group urlnames to help inform recommendations

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Approximate latitude

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Raw text location query

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Approximate longitude

parameters.name: min_groups
parameters.description: The minimum number of groups that have hosted events at this venue

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in miles. Defaults to members preferred radius

parameters.name: used_between
parameters.description: Return venues that have been used within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as 1m for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above).

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in
